column5: O - we entered before the 1st so no problems but these proposed tariffs could make for a real mess - not just financially but tearing cars apart trying to find this "contraband" could make for huge issues. we also had to pay an additional $100 each for HST now that the rebate is gone - and although I - like you - love every minute up there - everything has a price limit and these adders may cause some to not go. most all fly-in outfitters I know are hurting for business - busy as **** in June but after that, its "get whatever bookings you can". looking forward to hear from others about this. phish

So I'm foggy on this.... the border patrol is going to want to know every little item that I'm bringing across the border including pens, my 20yr old deck of playing cards, my 10yr old pillow, my 15yr old blanket, etc, etc, etc? And then I'll have to pay a 10% tax on stuff that old?I'm confused...these taxes should only apply to items bought in stores in Canada, and not what we bring across in our totes & coolers?
I can't imagine Canada Customs tearing your car apart to find something to charge a Tariff on. You aren't selling any of the stuff in Canada.
They've never said anything about the 20 gallons of gas I take and it is plainly visible.
I heard Gord was going to start charging in US $! LOL!

I would imagine that these tariffs don't apply to items that you will consume oe use while vacationing in Canada. I would think these apply to items imported into Canada for resale and manufacturing. Anyway I sure hope not.
Went through customs on July 3rd. One vehicle pulling an enclosed trailer and they never even asked to open the trailer. Crossing for our party of 5 took all of 5 minutes.
So than the sky isn't falling??
